TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 215

barker_notes.barker_summary: Green De Witt to Ramon Musquiz, May 8, 1829. Reports contraband trade which he has no means to stop. Indians.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 215

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Green De Witt to Ramon Musquiz, May 8, 1829. Reports contraband trade which he has no means to stop. Indians.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[From Bexar Archives]*/p*
*p*Dear Sir I feel it my duty to inform you that there is and has lately been a very considerable quantity of contraband passed on in the Direction of *location_mentioned*Bejar */location_mentioned*and I beleave both *person_mentioned*Mexicans */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Americans*/person_mentioned* are ingaged in that traffic— There are two *location_mentioned*roads */location_mentioned*formed within a few months which cross the *location_mentioned*Guadaluop */location_mentioned**location_mentioned*below this place one about a league, and the other about three leagues below this Town*/location_mentioned*— I have no *person_mentioned*troops */person_mentioned*at my command—and therefore it is out of my power to detect it without it should come through this *location_mentioned*town */location_mentioned*which they always avoid— This contraband is not owned by *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*under my Jurisdiction; neither do they wish it to pass through this *location_mentioned*neighborhood*/location_mentioned*, least they should be blamed for incouraging it; And you well remember the censure which has been thrown on me at the *location_mentioned*Labaca*/location_mentioned* on account of contraband of which I never took any part— And now again passing so near me compells me to give you this information; and hope there may be mean[s] taken to prevent its coming through our *location_mentioned*vicinity*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*The threats of the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*I fear will greatly retard the settling of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*; but should a Campaign be sent against them in a properly manner I think there can be an end put to them at once.*/p*
*p*Could a few *person_mentioned*troops */person_mentioned*be furnished us at this time, it would greatly add to the settling of the *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*, and there by strengthen the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I would be truly happy to recieve a line from you respecting the *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*and the probability of our geting some *person_mentioned*troops */person_mentioned*at this place etc.*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="05-03-1829">Five days ago */date_mentioned*another *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*arrived here from *location_mentioned*Missouri*/location_mentioned*; consist of a *person_mentioned*man */person_mentioned*and his *person_mentioned*wife */person_mentioned*and seven *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned*. "We have now in the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*thirty *person_mentioned*families*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Green DeWitt*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Gonzalez */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-08-1829">8th of may 1829*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*His *person_mentioned*Excellency Ramon Muzquiz Chief of the Department of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
